meanings.definition: The edge or margin of a steep place
meanings.sent1: She stood at the brinks of the cliff, feeling the wind on her face.
meanings.sent2: The hiker carefully approached the brinks of the canyon to get a better view.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel teetered on the brinks of the tree branch, trying to reach a nut.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the clouds gathered at the brinks of the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The old castle was perched on the brinks of the rocky hill, overlooking the valley below.

meanings.definition: A brink or point of time when something must be done
meanings.sent1: We were at the brinks of making a decision about our vacation destination.
meanings.sent2: The team was on the brinks of winning the championship when the final whistle blew.
meanings.sent3: The chef was at the brinks of burning the dinner, but managed to save it just in time.
meanings.sent4: As the deadline approached, she found herself at the brinks of completing the project.
meanings.sent5: The student was on the brinks of submitting the assignment when the power went out.
